item.title: Interpreting interaction in a regression model
item.description: Interaction with two binary variables In a regression model with interaction term, people tend to pay attention to only the coefficient of the interaction term. Letâ€™s start with the simpliest situation: \(x_1\) and \(x_2\) are binary and coded 0/1. \[ E(y) = \beta_1 x_1 + \beta_2 x_2 + \beta_{12} x_1x_2 \] In this case, we have a saturated model; that is, we have three coefficients representing additive effects from the baseline situation (both \(x_1\) and \(x_2\) being 0).
